comments:
While typing in JSP editor the javaw.exe process runs up to over 80% CPU.  I 
can save the JSP, but can do no typing.

If I clode the JSP, the CPU % goes back down.  I can then open a JSP up and 
edit it, however, soon the CPU cranks back up and I have the same issue.

Don't know if this is related, but "sometimes" I can still type when the CPU % 
is high, but the cursor doesn't move, so the characters I type come out in 
reverse order.

When I look at the log, I see over 200 entries for the following exception in 
less than 20 seconds time:

I don't see any type of pattern in what I'm doing to cause this error.  It 
seems to happen no matter if I'm in the debug perspective or the java 
perspective.

The java editor does not seem to have the problem.

Looks like incorrect threading protection problem. 
Marking as "P2" since I'd like to attend to these threading issues 
soon.
Greg, in which version of WTP are you seeing this?

Nitin pointed out to me that this stack contains "com.ibm.sse", not
"org.eclipse.sse". So, you'll have to work trough other product channels. 
Either its an issue you have to take up with those IBM folks :) 
Or, someone else is distributing our "com.ibm.sse" packages, in which 
case you'll have to take it up with that product (and, tell them they 
should not be doing that :)

This bug was moved to 'closed' state, since it is so old is is assumed its dup, invalid, or worksforme resolution is no longer in qustion and the bugzilla needs no further attention. Feel free to re-open, or open a new bug, if this semi-automatic processing was done in error in this case.
